activities.loc: Branch 3 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Landon J. Ruehlow

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference]] 
case called at 3:18pm 
Defendant Landon J. Ruehlow appears from the Dodge County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein does not appear [Attorney Klein has been in contact with court staff to inform the Court that she is delayed in another court] .  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court verifies with Mr. Ruehlow that he can see and hear the proceedings through the Zoom video-connection. 
The Court quashes the Warrant. 
After Mr. Ruehlow indicates that he would like to have contact with Attorney Klein, the Court indicates that it will have its JA notify Attorney Klein that she should make arrangements to meet with Mr. Ruehlow. 
recess 3:22pm 

NEXT:    Status Conference on November 15th at 3:00pm by Zoom conference--JA note in comments that case is at prelim stage
Voluntary appearance on October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Set for V/A w/ remote appearance
Correspondence to Judge Gruber re hearing to quash warrant
Extradition Forecast

[ma] Case called at 9:03am 
Defendant Landon J. Ruehlow not in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Landon J. Ruehlow.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Klein indicates that she has no explanation for Mr. Ruehlow's non appearance; phone number on file is not working. 

The Court reviews court record. 

ADA Teuber requests warrant be issued, and bond be found in default. 

The Court orders a bench warrant. 
The Court declares current bond in default. 

recess: 9:05am
Atty. Klein
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 10:47am 
Defendant Landon J. Ruehlow in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court summarizes that the Public Defenders Office has filed notice that it is continuing efforts to appoint counsel for Mr. Ruehlow.  
Mr. Ruehlow agrees that the Court should set the matter over to allow further time for the appointment of counsel. 
Mr. Ruehlow makes statements regarding having to take off work and travel from Watertown for status conferences, and asks that he not be required to appear at the next status conference.  The Court explains the need for his appearance, and that the next hearing date is more than two months out, so he has time to make arrangements to appear in person at the hearing as required.
recess 10:50am
[Post hearing:  Mr. Ruehlow verifies to the clerk that the N1078 Hwy. M address is current.] 

NEXT:  Status Conference (status of counsel hearing) on September 19th at 9:00am --JA note in comments that the case is at prelim stage
Status of Counsel
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ml] Case called at 8:41AM
Defendant Landon J. Ruehlow in court, without counsel. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The State notes that it does have an officer witness present for the Preliminary Hearing today.
The Court sets this matter over for a Status of Counsel hearing as the Defendant has not yet been appointed counsel.

recess 8:48PM

NEXT: 
(1) Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 07/11 at 10:00AM
(2) JA - Per Judge's request, please flag this case for review for approximately two weeks before the next hearing RE: Counsel for the Defendant
Pre-trial conference on May 11, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
DA Routing Slip
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 1:31pm 
.Defendant Landon J. Ruehlow appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf ( the PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Rumpf provides an updated address for Mr. Ruehlow:  N1078 Hwy. M, Watertown WI 53098.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

During arguments on Bond, Mr. Ruehlow acknowledges that he knows the identity of Victim 1 as referenced in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court requires a $1,500 Signature Bond with conditions:
--not to make any acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1 as stated in the Victim Witness Key and the Criminal Complaint 
recess 1:37 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on April 20th at 11:40am--only counsel need to appear.,  (2) Preliminary Hearing on May 19th at 8:30am
